nodes.bodyText: it's a nit, but I prefer that the serialVersionUID is the first line in the class, so that it doesn't distract from the other "more useful" fields in the class.

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters

             * Copyright (c) 2019 IBM Corporation and others.
          
          
            
             * Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.

I'd undo these before you merge.  They are valuable for development/debugging now, but will add a lot of trace output for every build that we should probably avoid.  Or at least set it to the same settings that the MP OT team had previously set - I'm fine with moving from server.xml to bootstrap.properties, but the OT team should also approve that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -9,4 +9,6 @@
 #     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
 ###############################################################################
 bootstrap.include=../testports.properties
-com.ibm.ws.logging.trace.specification=*=info
\ No newline at end of file
+com.ibm.ws.logging.trace.specification=*=info:com.ibm.ws.opentracing*=all:com.ibm.ws.microprofile.opentracing*=all:com.ibm.ws.jaxrs*=all:com.ibm.websphere.jaxrs*=all:org.apache.cxf.*=all
+com.ibm.ws.logging.max.file.size=900
+com.ibm.ws.logging.max.files=5

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,80 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2019 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-Name: JAX-RS Default Exception Mapper
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.jaxrs.defaultexceptionmapper
+Bundle-Description: IBM JAX-RS Default Exception Mapper; version=${bVersion}
+
+
+WS-TraceGroup: JAXRS
+
+Import-Package: \
+    !*.internal.*,*
+
+Export-Package: \
+    com.ibm.ws.jaxrs.defaultexceptionmapper
+    
+
+DynamicImport-Package: \
+ javax.xml.ws, \
+ javax.xml.ws.*, \
+ javax.xml.bind, \
+ javax.xml.bind.annotation, \
+ javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters, \
+ javax.xml.bind.attachment, \
+ javax.xml.bind.helpers, \
+ javax.xml.bind.util
+ 
+Liberty-Monitoring-Components: 
+
+-dsannotations:  \
+ 	com.ibm.ws.jaxrs.defaultexceptionmapper

nodes.bodyText:
this class will need to be added to the bnd file under -dsannotations
Also, it should have the same annotation attributes that I mentioned in the 1.1 project.
delete
I'm not sure this is necessary - I thought opentracing-1.0 already depended on jaxrs-2.0
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,7 @@
   <featureManager>
     <feature>servlet-3.1</feature>
     <feature>opentracing-1.0</feature>
+    <feature>jaxrs-2.0</feature>

nodes.bodyText: If we want callback implementations to be able to return null to indicate that they don't need to add any headers, then there should be a null check here to only call putAll if the returned map is not null.
This should include @TraceOptions - take a look at some of the other JAX-RS package-info.java files for examples.

nodes.bodyText: Just nitpicking here.  The indentation of this file varies from 1-4 spaces.
2 import statements in one line
